itemDescription: Irish general and aide-de-camp under Simón Bolívar

wikipedia_page.main: Daniel Florence O'Leary (Irish: Dónall Fínín Ó Laoghaire; 1801–1854) was a military general and aide-de-camp under Simón Bolívar.

response: *Daniel Florence O'Leary- Irish-born Venezuelan brigadier general of Simón Bolívar's army

link_mentions.page: The Revolution Will Not Be Televised (film)
response: In 2000, Bartley and Ó Briain had been promised "exclusive access" to Chávez by the government's Minister of Communications. They arrived in Venezuela in September 2001. While filming the pilot they met the president, after which they reconsidered their approach.Stoneman (2008), p. 18. Bartley explained, "We had ... this notion of investigating Chávez—was he a demagogue? Was the media persona just that? What makes him tick? My sense had changed as we got closer; what we're seeing here is a guy who is motivated, driven, not the demagogue with another side, drinking, carousing. I began to see him as more transparent—what you see is what you get." Bartley and Ó Briain began by attempting to build a relationship with Chávez that would allow them the access they required. At first, the president's staff treated the filmmakers with suspicion and made filming difficult. After numerous delays, Bartley and Ó Briain finally got through to Chávez. They calculated that they needed to "press the right buttons" to gain his support, so they presented  him with an old edition of the memoirs of the general Daniel Florence O'Leary, who had fought alongside Simón Bolívar.Stoneman (2008), p. 19. Inside, they had written a quote from the Irish socialist playwright Seán O'Casey. Slowly, Bartley and Ó Briain gained their subjects' trust, "dissolving any self-consciousness as a result of their cameras".Stoneman (2008), p. 20.

In response to Cordova's rebellion, Irish General Daniel Florence O'Leary was commissioned by Bolivar to render Cordova. The ensuing battle took place near El Santuario, Antioquia, where Córdova died by the hand of the Irish Commander Rupert Hand, on the 17th of October, 1829.

link_mentions.page: List of ambassadors of the United Kingdom to Colombia

response: * 1st Riverine Command LTGEN Daniel Florence O'Leary
*Daniel Florence O'Leary (c.1802–1854), Irish-born South American brigadier general
